intro: Iriartea nivea, commonly known as the white-veined puya, is a striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, upright stems and large, waxy, white-veined leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences that are typically pink or red, adding to its ornamental appeal. Iriartea nivea is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool, humid conditions. Its unique morphology and striking appearance make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservatories.
